intro: Antirrhinum canadense, commonly known as the Canadian toadflax, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and disturbed areas. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. Antirrhinum canadense is an important plant in ecological studies due to its role in supporting pollinators and its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
